results.title: The Summer game
results.brief_description: Traces the history of cricket from its origin as a two stump game played by yokels on the village green, through its phase as a betting sport after the Restoration, to the modern counterpart played by professionals.

results.title: The Summer before
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films, Peter Llewellin and Donald Brittain
results.brief_description: Shows high performance athletes and Canadian teams preparing for the 1976 Olympic Games at Montreal. Formation, drive, competition, and personal disappointment are the subjects tackled in this film.

results.title: The Sum of us [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Southern Star Entertainment, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Hal McElroy, Kevin Dowling and Geoff Burton
results.brief_description: Harry (Jack Thompson) is a widower whose life centres around getting his gay son, Jeff (Russell Crowe), to settle down with a nice man. They live together in working-class Sydney, sharing a home, a few beers and a shared bemusement about the rites of masculinity (both straight and queer) in the post-sexual revolution 1990s. Based on David Steven’s award-winning play, “The Sum of Us” is a wonderful comedy about sons and fathers, a loving tribute to the tenderness and comraderie that can be found between men. Though some gay and lesbian critics disliked the film because of its obvious stage-bound script and the unashamed masculinity of Crowe’s gay son, by focussing on working class rather than bourgeois sexuality, “The Sum of Us” can also be seen as a film that radically redefines the boundaries of Australian masculinity and sexuality. Crowe makes a handsome and likeable central character and Jack Thompson is wonderful as the committed, generous father willing to do whatever it takes to make his son happy.

results.title: The Sum of all fears
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, MFP Munich Film Partners GmbH, AZL Productions KG, Mace Neufeld and Phil Alden Robinson
results.brief_description: Based on the best-selling novel by Tom Clancy with screenplay by Paul Attanasia and Daniel Pyne, this political thriller revives the tensions and paranoia of the Cold War era between the Americans and the Russians when the CIA suspect that Russia is once again involved in the development of nuclear weapons. Suspense and intrigue follow as a terrorist plot brings the two super-powers to the brink of nuclear war. Starring Ben Affleck as the rather young CIA agent Jack Ryan and Morgan Freeman as CIA Director William Cabot with James Cromwell, Liev Schreiber, Bridget Moynahan, Alan Bates.

results.title: The Sullivans: on the brink of war. The Court martial [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Crawford Productions, Henry Crawford, John Barningham, Ian Crawford, Ian Jones and Murray Reece
results.brief_description: In production at the same time as “Cop shop”, “The Sullivans” proved to be phenomenally successful for Crawford Productions running for six years (1115 episodes, 1976-1982) and exported to over 70 countries. “The Sullivans” whet the British appetite for Australian soap and paved the way for a long and healthy relationship between Australian soap (Prisoner, Neighbours, Home and Away) and British viewers. Originally screened on Channel 9, most production took place in the Melbourne suburb of Canterbury due to its proximity to the studios. The series prided itself on historical accuracy and was from the perspective of an “average” Australian family and their experience on the home front during World War II - Dave and Grace Sullivan, their only daughter Kitty, and sons Tom, Jo, and Terry. Also populating the family’s milieu are nosy neighbour Mrs Jessup, Dave’s pub companion and war buddy, Norm, and local publican Maggie Hayward. This DVD contains the first four episodes of the series and depicts the countdown to war: beginning September 1939, the third last day of peace. Kitty and Terry lose their father’s watch whilst trespassing on the hermit’s property that Mrs Jessup is horrified to discover Kitty has befriended. Mrs Jessup takes on new boarders with a mysterious past and the family of Jo Sullivan’s fiancee, Anna, are being persecuted because of their German origins. Also included on the disk is the episode “The Court martial” in which Mel Gibson guest stars as Lieutenant Ray Henderson who has to represent Kitty’s friend, Eddie, charged with being a deserter. Cast includes Lorraine Bayly, Paul Cronin, Vivean Grey, Susan Hannaford, Andrew McFarlane, Ingrid Mason, Richard Morgon, Steven Tandy and Norman Yemm.

results.title: The Sui gas pipeline
results.creator_credit: Rayant Pictures, Anthony Gilkison and William Pollard
results.brief_description: In 1952, over 4 million cubic feet of high-pressure gas was discovered in a great natural reservoir under the Baluchistan Desert at Sui, Pakistan. This film tells the story of the major development work that followed the discovery and deals with the laying of pipe-lines from the Sui gas field to Karachi, 348 miles away.

results.title: The Sugar disease
results.brief_description: This film looks at the problem of diabetes, its origins and the research going on to discover its causes. In addition, four well-known people who are diabetics talk about themselves and their lives as diabetics. Canadian scientist, Dr Best, recalls his involvement in the discovery of insulin in 1921.

results.title: The Stylist
results.creator_credit: MPO Productions, Joseph March and Lewis Jacobs
results.brief_description: Reveals the automobile designer, working behind guarded doors to style the “dream cars” for the following year, and the more distant future. Endeavours to explain pictorially the process by which the stylist finds inspiration for new body designs to charm the customer. Prologue spoken by William Clay Ford, vice president of Ford Motor Co. Music by Sol Kaplan. Cinematography by Stan Meredith. Narrated by Shepperd Strudwick.

results.title: The Stunt woman [Dubbed version]
results.creator_credit: Golden Bowl, Daca Entertainment, Catherine Hun, David Lau and Ann Hui
results.brief_description: Ah Kam (Michelle Yeoh) is a stuntwoman trying to break into the male dominated arena of the martial art movie. A fearless perfectionist, intent on making her mark and earning the respect of her peers, she teams with a director known as ‘The Chief’ with whom she forms a professional and personal bond. On his latest flick The Chief is working against a tight deadline and places his stunt crew in jeopardy in order to get the job done. Kam displays a loyalty to The Chief that compromises her wellbeing as she performs some terrifying stunts whilst injured. Several subplots involve bar room brawling, the Hong Kong triads, after hours carousing and romance for Kam with a duplicitous playboy. Yeoh is convincing as Kam, a woman with ambition and determination to make it in a tough arena whilst displaying a familial loyalty to her colleagues. The film is an interesting behind the scenes look at the making of martial arts movies and the danger of injury that hangs over career stunt men and women. Yeoh was seriously injured during one stunt, jumping from a bridge, the footage of which is screened under the end credits. Dubbed version in English.
